sentence.Network_en: Many black Namibians are subsistence farmers who live in the arid borderlands.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多生活在土地贫瘠的边境地区的纳米比亚黑人农场主的收成仅够维持自身的口粮。

sentence.Network_en: These trees will shield off arid winds and protect the fields.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些树能挡住旱风,保护农田.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French aride or Latin aridus, from arere 'be dry or parched'

entry.def: Arid land is so dry that very few plants can grow on it.

example.ex: ...new strains of crops that can withstand arid conditions.
example.tran: 能抵抗干旱条件的新品种作物

entry.tran: 枯燥无味的；乏善可陈的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a period of your life or an academic subject as arid, you mean that it has so little interest, excitement, or purpose that it makes you feel bored or unhappy.

example.ex: She had given him the only joy his arid life had ever known.
example.tran: 她为他枯燥无味的生活带来了从未有过的乐趣。

example.ex: ...the politically arid years of military dictatorship in the 1960s and '70s.
example.tran: 在20世纪60和70年代军事独裁期间政事荒芜的岁月

sentences.sentence: "a technically perfect but arid performance of the sonata"
"a prissy and emotionless creature...settles into a mold of desiccated snobbery"-C.J.Rolo

auth_sentence.content: The mountains underneath were arid as craters on the moon.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The mountains underneath were arid as craters on the moon.

auth_sentence.content: It includes extensive lowland deserts as well as semi-arid steppes.
